description: The tap interfaces are not correctly removed when an IVS port is deleted in nova.
title: interface not deleted on unplug when using IVS

comments.content: The tap interfaces are not correctly removed when an IVS port is deleted in nova.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kevinbenton

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/42975
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/42975
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/b9bfedcefd081921224a13fd08faa6a1293f8882
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit b9bfedcefd081921224a13fd08faa6a1293f8882
Author: Kevin Benton <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Aug 20 05:46:05 2013 -0700

    Fix IVS vif to correctly delete interfaces on unplug
    
    The IVS unplug method was incorrectly calling the OVS
    specific interface removal methods. This corrects it
    to call the IVS removal methods.
    
    Fixes: bug #1214532
    Change-Id: Ie718e167d5bdcfae0d915ef85976aeeb3449ad18
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
